attributes.action: Urge Redcar and Cleveland Borough Council to abandon plans to introduce 'pinch points' on Redcar Lane.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Council is considering plans for 'traffic calming'  along Redcar Lane, (ie. pinch points, electronic signs).  see:- http://www.redcar-cleveland.gov.uk/PressRel.nsf/Published/B82F28F9F1EAAC0E802573DE002FF18E?OpenDocument

Speed activated signs are an excellent idea. But, they need to look at innovative solutions rather than punitive tactics. Redcar Lane has had, 6,6,7,8,6 accidents over 5 yrs: remarkable considering the inc. in pop. on the Mickledales. 

This will shift traffic elsewhere. Next year we will no doubt 'need' the same on Kirkleatham Lane, then West Dyke Rd the year after and so on. In 10 yrs Redcar will be impassable, how did we let it happen? Already:-

· Redcar Lane – parts 40mph to 30mph 
· Greenstones Rd – pinch points  
· Plantation Rd – 60 to 30 + pinch points
· Redcar Rd – 60 to 30
· Coast Rd (Green Lane to Marske) 60 to 40
· Esplanade – rumble, speed cushions, speed bumps
· Lord St. – traffic light central
· Over 30 other roads affected by pinch points and speed bumps.
